      • setState

        public void setState(boolean value)
        Set the value of this BooleanSink Set the value of this DigitalOutput
        Specified by:
        setState in interface BooleanSink
        Parameters:
        value - the value true = High, false = Low

      • pulse

        public final void pulse(double pulseLength)
        Generate a single pulse. Write a pulse to the specified digital output channel. There can only be a single pulse going at any time.
        Parameters:
        pulseLength - The length of the pulse.

      • isPulsing

        public final boolean isPulsing()
        Determine if the pulse is still going. Determine if a previously started pulse is still going.
        Returns:
        true if pulsing

      • setPWMRate

        public static final void setPWMRate(double rate)
        Change the PWM frequency of the PWM output on a Digital Output line. The valid range is from 0.6 Hz to 19 kHz. The frequency resolution is logarithmic. There is only one PWM frequency for all channnels.
        Parameters:
        rate - The frequency to output all digital output PWM signals.

      • enablePWM

        public final void enablePWM(double initialDutyCycle)
        Enable a PWM Output on this line. Allocate one of the 6 DO PWM generator resources. Supply the initial duty-cycle to output so as to avoid a glitch when first starting. The resolution of the duty cycle is 8-bit for low frequencies (1kHz or less) but is reduced the higher the frequency of the PWM signal is.
        Parameters:
        initialDutyCycle - The duty-cycle to start generating. [0..1]

      • disablePWM

        public final void disablePWM()
        Change this line from a PWM output back to a static Digital Output line. Free up one of the 6 DO PWM generator resources that were in use.

      • updateDutyCycle

        public final void updateDutyCycle(double dutyCycle)
        Change the duty-cycle that is being generated on the line. The resolution of the duty cycle is 8-bit for low frequencies (1kHz or less) but is reduced the higher the frequency of the PWM signal is.
        Parameters:
        dutyCycle - The duty-cycle to change to. [0..1]
